title: Death on the Fourposter (1964, Horror) John Drew Barrymore, Gloria Milland, Luisa Rivelli | Movie

sources.title: Death on the Fourposter (1964, Horror) John Drew Barrymore, Gloria Milland, Luisa Rivelli | Movie
sources.description:
The party turns deadly! Mystery, mind games & murder.
A group of friends visit a mansion owned by Riccardo, an artist. Strange events unfold, including predictions of tragedy and murder. As suspicion grows, they uncover dark secrets hidden within the castle.

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/hCv0bBMguTw


Original title: Delitto allo specchio (1964) AKA: Sexy Party / Death on the Fourposter 

This film has English audio, and subtitled in many languages.

Directors: Jean Josipovici, Ambrogio Molteni
Writers: Jean Josipovici, Giorgio Stegani
Stars: John Drew Barrymore, Gloria Milland, Luisa Rivelli
Genre: Italian giallo film, Horror, Thriller


00:00 Full Movie (with subtitles)
00:33 Exploration of a mysterious castle with intriguing characters and unexpected events.
08:04 Mysterious events unfold at a castle party, involving relationships and secrets among the guests.
12:36 Intriguing events unfold during a party at a secluded location, involving various characters and interactions.
20:23 A group of friends engage in a dice game that reveals their true desires and tests their relationships.
26:58 Supernatural occurrences unfold during a chilling experiment involving past and future revelations.
39:37 Mysterious events unfold during a gathering, leading to unexpected discoveries and revelations.
52:27 A group of individuals encounter a series of mysterious events involving prophecies and disappearances.
57:56 Investigation of a mysterious murder reveals missing ring, potential suspects, and motive.
1:07:32 Mysterious events unfold as a group searches for a missing person in a secluded location, leading to suspicion and fear.
1:14:47 A group searches for a missing person in a mysterious house, uncovering secrets and facing danger.
1:23:56 Murder mystery unfolds as Ricky is accused of killing Franca, with evidence implicating him found in a garden.
